com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.rmi.util

Class RMIApplicationBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.rmi.util.RMIApplicationBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IComponent, IHasAttributes, IConfigurable, IRegisterable, Serializable, Remote
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RmiApplication

    public class RMIApplicationBase
extends UnicastRemoteObject
implements IComponent, IConfigurable
    Base for a remote (RMI) object that can register itself with RMI on creation.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RMIApplicationBase

        public RMIApplicationBase(String name,
                          int registryPort,
                          boolean createRegistry,
                          boolean autoExpose)
                   throws RemoteException
        A non null name implies that application can be monitored through this name.
        Parameters:
        name - Name with which object is registered. If null, object is not registered with RMI at all.
        registryPort - Port with which RMI registry is associated.
        createRegistry - If true, an RMI registry is created. Otherwise, it will look for a preexisting registry.
        autoExpose - whether to register this object with RMI upon construction
        Throws:
        RemoteException - if a communication-related problem occurs

      • RMIApplicationBase

        public RMIApplicationBase(String name,
                          boolean createRegistry)
                   throws RemoteException
        Uses default registry port.
        Parameters:
        name - Name with which object is registered. If null, object is not registered with RMI at all.
        createRegistry - If true, an RMI registry is created. Otherwise, it will look for a preexisting registry.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - if a communication-related problem occurs

      • RMIApplicationBase

        public RMIApplicationBase(String name)
                   throws RemoteException
        Creates registry at default registry port.
        Parameters:
        name - Name with which object is registered. If null, object is not registered with RMI at all.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - if a communication-related problem occurs

      • RMIApplicationBase

        public RMIApplicationBase(RMISocketFactory rmiSocketFactory)
                   throws RemoteException
        This constructor allows the use of a custom RMI socket factory.
        Parameters:
        rmiSocketFactory - The socket factory to use when creating sockets for this object.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - if a communication-related problem occurs

      • RMIApplicationBase

        public RMIApplicationBase()
                   throws RemoteException
        This constructor implies that the application will not be monitored.

        The only overhead of monitoring is a short delay in the creation of new Session's (while they are registered with RMI). Monitoring adds a negligible delay when running.

        Throws:
        RemoteException - if a communication-related problem occurs

                   throws RemoteException

      • start

        public void start(String name,
                  int registryPort,
                  boolean createRegistry)
           throws RemoteException
        Marks object as started if name is not null and and an RMI registry is located.

        Does nothing if already started.

        Parameters:
        name - TBD
        registryPort - RMI port to be used by registry. If -1 the default RMI port is used.
        createRegistry - TBD
        Throws:
        RemoteException - if a communication-related problem occurs

      • closeComponent

        public boolean closeComponent()
                       throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: IComponent
        Component permanently ceases operation. Any allocated resources should be returned.

        No other component methods will be called after this.

        Specified by:
        closeComponent in interface IComponent
        Returns:
        Previous open state.
        Throws:
        Exception - if it was unable to completely close. It should not throw an exception until it has closed itself as fully as possible.

      • getComponentStatus

        public IComponentStatus getComponentStatus()
        Description copied from interface: IComponent
        Returns the component's current state.

        Every component has state which can change with time. For example, the total number of objects a component has processed may be kept as part of its state.

        Attributes, by contrast, can only be changed by calling setAttribute.

        Specified by:
        getComponentStatus in interface IComponent
        Returns:
        null if the component does not expose its state.

      • configure

        public void configure(IConfiguration configuration)
               throws ConfigurationException
        Description copied from interface: IConfigurable
        Apply the IConfiguration to this IConfigurable.

        This method is called by the configuration module in the server:

        • when loading the configuration at server startup (e.g. when reading the XML configuration file) and
        • every time we reload the configuration object corresponding to the configurable run-time object.
        The Catalys Server passes a reference to a configuration clone. The original reference is unavailable to the configurable object. The configurable object may decide to store the reference as the last valid configuration object which can be used to optimize the re-configuration.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface IConfigurable
        Parameters:
        configuration - the immutable configuration object
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - This exception is thrown when the new configuration object cannot be applied to the configurable object.

      • getConfiguration

        public IConfiguration getConfiguration()
        Description copied from interface: IConfigurable
        Return the last valid configuration.
        Specified by:
        getConfiguration in interface IConfigurable
        Returns:
        Reference to the last IConfiguration used to successfully configure this IConfigurable.

      • setRegistrationName

        public void setRegistrationName(Name name)
        Description copied from interface: IRegisterable
        set the registration name. Every registered object should know its registration name. The rule of thumb is: once the object is bound in the registry the name should be set.
        Specified by:
        setRegistrationName in interface IRegisterable

        name - registration name
